overrides.canonical_meaning: This section explains that each planet has specific zodiac signs where it tends to express more strength (exaltation) and where it tends to express less strength (debilitation).
This section introduces a basic classification of planets into benefic and malefic categories for interpretive use.

The text links strong malefic affliction of Cancer-related indicators (including the fourth-house domain and the Moon) with increased risk of significant lung or chest health sensitivity; partial benefic support is described as moderating this signal.

Jupiter in the first house is presented as a generally supportive indicator for personal vitality, learning orientation, and social respect; the text also notes that afflictions can reduce this support.

rule.label: Jupiter in the first house (general supportive association).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the first house can be associated with a stronger learning orientation, constructive guidance from mentors, and generally supportive personal direction.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a curated normalization of a book statement; it is treated as a low-confidence background indicator until reviewed.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Jupiter in the second house is described as supporting resource stability, constructive speech, and family support, while noting that strength and context can change how this manifests.

rule.label: Jupiter in the second house (resources and speech association).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the second house can correlate with steadier resource-building and a more constructive communication style, depending on broader chart context.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a normalized book association for a house placement and is treated as a low-confidence background indicator until reviewed.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Jupiter in the third house is presented as supporting helpful sibling dynamics and practical initiative, with outcomes varying by overall condition and supporting factors.

rule.label: Jupiter in the third house (initiative and sibling dynamics).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the third house can be associated with steadier initiative, learning-by-doing, and supportive sibling or peer connections, depending on context.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a normalized association from the book; it should be reviewed and refined with supported context operators if needed.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Jupiter in the fourth house is described as supporting home stability, education, and general comfort, while noting that afflictions can reduce this support.

rule.label: Jupiter in the fourth house (home and education support).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the fourth house can correlate with steadier home support and learning opportunities, though the strength of the signal depends on broader chart factors.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a curated normalization of a book claim; treated as a background signal until reviewed against your engine context.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Jupiter in the fifth house is described as supporting learning, creativity, and positive connections with children, while noting that adverse factors can weaken this expression.

rule.label: Jupiter in the fifth house (learning and creativity association).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the fifth house can be associated with stronger learning orientation and constructive creative expression, depending on overall chart context.

variant_meta.certainty_note: Normalized from the book; this should be reviewed and refined as you add more supported operators for nuance.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Jupiter in the sixth house is linked with greater involvement in competition, obligations, or disputes; the text also suggests that strengthening Jupiter is treated as a mitigating approach.

rule.label: Jupiter in the sixth house (obligations and competition sensitivity).

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the sixth house can correlate with a stronger focus on service, responsibilities, or competitive situations, with outcomes varying based on overall chart support.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a normalized placement association; it is intentionally framed cautiously and requires review for your engine context.

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the seventh house can be associated with stronger partnership focus and relationship-driven opportunities, with the expression depending on broader chart context.

variant_meta.certainty_note: Derived from a book statement; kept as a low-confidence background indicator until reviewed.

effect_json.outcome_text: Jupiter in the eighth house can correlate with more complex life transitions and greater variability in outcomes, depending on overall chart support and planetary condition.

overrides.canonical_meaning: When Jupiter-related indicators are described as weak, the text suggests strengthening practices such as charitable giving and devotional practice; gemstone recommendations appear but are treated as out-of-scope for the current remedies schema.

remedies.name: Optional charitable giving for learning and guidance
remedies.description: Offer a small, comfortable contribution to an education, mentorship, or learning-support cause on a regular basis, with a calm and respectful intention.
remedies.safety_notes: Give only within your financial comfort; avoid debt or pressure-based giving.

remedies.name: Optional Jupiter-focused mantra repetition
remedies.description: Spend a few minutes daily in quiet repetition of a short Jupiter-focused mantra or prayer from your own tradition, keeping the practice steady and non-compulsive.
remedies.safety_notes: Keep the practice emotionally safe and time-bounded; this is supportive and should not replace practical decision-making or medical care.

overrides.canonical_meaning: Saturn in the sixth house creates sustained pressure in health management, where throat, respiratory, and digestive health require greater attention and care. Back pain may be a recurring concern, and childhood injuries may require careful management. The placement also indicates capability for significant work and handling of responsibilities.

rule.label: Saturn in the sixth house (health pressure and service responsibilities).

effect_json.outcome_text: Saturn in the sixth house can create sustained pressure in health management, where throat, respiratory, and digestive health require greater attention and care. Back pain may be a recurring concern, and childhood injuries may require careful management. If unmanaged, these health areas may lead to ongoing challenges. The placement also indicates capability for significant work and handling of responsibilities.

variant_meta.certainty_note: This is a normalized placement association; it is intentionally framed neutrally and requires review for your engine context.
